revised_title: Improvement of the Clark and Cadmium Cells as Standards of Electromotive Force
tldr: The authors investigate various methods of manufacturing mercurous sulphate for use in the Clark and cadmium cells as standards of electromotive force. They find that the size of the crystals of the depolarizer is crucial for the cell's efficiency, and recommend a specific method of preparation. The authors also test the recuperative power of the cadmium cell and its temperature coefficient.
